newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers steady amid regional competition.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers steady amid regional competition.

text.p: Singapore bunker indications on Tuesday were little changed from Monday, with some demand seen lured away by cheaper prices in South Korea and Taiwan, brokers and shipowners said.
"Adding on the wharf-charges, I would rather bunker in South Korea or Taiwan," said a shipowner.
Majors were quoting 180-cst at $126-$128 per tonne and 380-cst at $121-$122. Independents were at $125-$126 per tonne for 180 cst and at $121-$122 for 380-cst.
MDO prices also were stable at $223-228 and gas oil at $238-$245. -- Singapore newsroom (+65-870-3082)
